Reviews.Title: “Great for an overnight in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ExPatinNica
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice for one night when I had an overnight layover in Istanbul. The hotel was clean, the staff friendly and very helpful, the restaurant good, and the gym really one of the best. Also it is right near the subway so if you have enough time you can jump right on the subway and go do a little sight-seeing. My only real complaint is that the AC did not really cool the room well either time and I had other friends who had the same experience.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a five star hotel, but it charges 5 star prices”
Reviews.Author: davidtphillips
Reviews.Content: Â£5 for 33cl beer. The air conditioning was not working. In fact turning it on made the room even hotter

Reviews.Title: “Great location only if you fly in late and need to fly out early”
Reviews.Author: PRATANA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely close to the airport, less than 5 minute taxi ride but it is not a 5 stars. They have two big buildings adjacent to each other, one is the WOW Convention hotel and the other is WOW airport. The taxi we took just dropped us at the first WOW hotel builidng and we had no idea the two buildings are off different hotels (both of them has WOW name on the top). The reception told us the airport hotel is next door so we had to carry our own luggages to other building at 1am. The room was ok but the air in the room was not. The windows couldn't open but there was no air con. The aircon control said 10 degree celsius but the temperature in the room must have been 40c, very hot, humid, stuffy and moldy. We only stayed for a few hours since our flight arrived around 1am and the next morning we flew out at 8am. The worst part of the hotel is its thin wall. We were woken up several times during our little hours of sleep (around 2-6am) by many phone wake up calls that rang right into your ears although they were other rooms' wake up calls. Imagining we only had 4 hours of sleep time but got woken up every hour by the phone ring. If you don't have a late arrival flight and early morning one to catch, I do not recommend the hotel. Oh, also about the airport shuttle, they only run to a certain time so if you arrive so late or so early, you need a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently close”
Reviews.Author: joesmithChicago
Reviews.Content: This was the typical airport hotel. Close to airport, just a short taxi ride. The metro station (a very good way to travel in Istanbul) was within 200 meters. The facilities in the room were good but not spectacular, nice lighting, minibar, comfortable bed. But it seemed overpriced to me considering that there is nothing in the neighborhood to see or do. Not exactly in the center of things.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Wow place”
Reviews.Author: Travel284
Reviews.Content: If you need to be near airport it's fine. It can be noisy with the adjacent train line. Choose your room carefully! Food is just so so.

Reviews.Title: “If you like plane spotting.....”
Reviews.Author: jkf0807
Reviews.Content: Close vicinity of the airport, easy to get to and overall fine hotel. But the 5* is certainly overrated, rather it should be 4 (at best) due to the limited facilities (restaurant, bar, breakfast etc.) But if you need fast access to the airport and can get a good deal the hotel is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TurCan
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is 3 minutes to the airport. The cab ride costs $4. They also offer free shuttle every half hour. However, it certainly does not feel like a 5-star (the musty rooms, the iffy restaurant, the undertrained staff, the cheap breakfast). I would rate it a 3.5-star. And it is mosty certainly not worth the 170 Euros they charge. The TAV airport hotel is actually at the airport, and it costs 100 Euros. BTW, there is NOTHING near this hotel; no bar, no restaurant, no convenience center. It is really in the middle of nowhere. There is a convention center nextdoor, and I suppose if you are attending a convention this can be a convenient location. Also, there is a metro station nearby, but if you arte staying at an airport hotel you are unlikely to use the metro. All in all, I cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: Hivedoc
Reviews.Content: The WOW hotel is 5 minutes from the international airport in Istanbul. It is a bit odd with a fair amount of security when you enter the complex. The hotel is nondescript and has a slightly old and seedy feel as well as a bit of that 1980s musty hotel smell. The hotel complex is isolated (surrounded by highways) and one could not take a walk from the hotel to anywhere. However, there is a great neighborhood 10 minutes away by cab with a pedestrian area and large western malls to kill a bit of time. This hotel is an ideal stay for those having an early morning flight who do not want to fight Istanbul traffic. There would never be any reason to spend more than one night there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good hotel, restaurant aside”
Reviews.Author: vitting
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the WOW airport hotel 4 days in February. Note there are two WOW hotels next to each other. One is 5 star and the other 4 star. I stayed in the 4 star. The room was very nice and clean. Nice minibar selection but no kettle and tea/coffee. Roomservice was great too and staff very friendly. Staff in the restaurant were also very friendly and hadn't it been for the food, we would have eaten there all nights. We ended up however only having dinner there one night, as the food was quite disappointing. Not the great Turkish cuisine we would have expected of a 4 star hotel. I would stay here again though as the location is fantastic - very close to the airport, a screen with flight departures and arrivals in the lobby, and very easy to get around if you are in Istanbul for business. I wouldn't choose this hotel if I was here on holiday though.

Reviews.Title: “near to airport”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Close to airport. Free shuttle service every half hour. You may need a taxi or a shuttle bus to see Istanbul because it is not close to downtown. Free internet was very useful. The room I had was spacious and well furnished. The breakfast bar was good. Wine at the restaurant was very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Very near to airport and train station.”
Reviews.Author: russ-the-rover
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in two towers, one 4 star, one 5 star, I stayed in the 5 star and the cost is not stupid. The rooms are nice, if just a little dated, good size bed, flat screen TV, mini bar etc, just what you expect. The food is OK but not up to the standard of some of the nice places in down-town Istanbul. The WIFI if free, but it is not very good, keeps droping out! The free bus from the airport is OK, every 30 mins, but it would only cost about 10TL to take a taxi, so it is up to you. The hotel is a long way out of the city, but about 100m from the hotel you can catch the train into the city if you want an adventure. Would I stay again, for a meeing at the airport yes, to see Istanbul no, it is too far out.

Reviews.Title: “great place for overnight stay close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Emily S
Reviews.Content: We flew into Istanbul only to sleep over and fly out the next morning. This is a great hotel to stay at for an overnight stay close to the airport. It's far from the city, so I wouldn't recommend it if you're interesting in touring Istanbul. But it's a reasonably priced hotel, it was extremely clean, the rooms were large compared to the hotels in the city, and the staff was professional. The room service was prompt and the food was good. A nice bonus is the complimentary breakfast to eat before your flight. This was also a very tasty traditional Turkish buffet breakfast. The only advice is that the Wow airport shuttle does not have a sign at the airport curbside so you have to make sure that you look out for it to arrive at the scheduled time shown on the website. The shuttle is nice, clean, and only about a 5min ride to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars not worth”
Reviews.Author: polarnicka
Reviews.Content: Not really English speaking persons. Hotel tried to charge me three times, once for 2500 eur for 4 nights. Overall i havent had troubles then, but I wont recommed.

Reviews.Title: “Passing Through”
Reviews.Author: 1st-sterling-homes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Ataturk airport which was very useful for us. The staff were very efficient and our bags were brought to our room after our check-in. The room itself was clean and had all that you would require and more for an overnight stopover. From the bedroom window we could see the aircraft taking off and the legendary Istanbul traffic jams of course. The bed was comfortable and there were extra pillows. Its a pity that the walls weren't sound deadened as we could hear everything that the couple next door were doing!! And then the shower running afterwards. The breakfast next morning was average, it did seem to be suiting the Turkish people though.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: tinkaminka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect for people in transit. There's a free shuttle bus to and from the airport (check the reception desk for hours) and the rooms are perfect. The only downside is that they don't allow food delivery and the hotel menu was not interesting and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you really need to catch an early flight the next morning”
Reviews.Author: Istkid
Reviews.Content: With so many things to do, places to see and great restaurants to go, locking yourself 1 hour away from the city action it's a crime! The hotel is totally uneventful, the only thing here is the 2 minutes ride and 5 minutes walk from the airport. The breakfast follow the "uneventfulness" of the rest, nothing outstanding, just a basic, self service, turkish breakfast. The rooms are quite spacious, mine was a bit worn out, windows are locked and you cannot open them. People at the reception are ok, very helpful and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to relax overnight waiting for your next day flight”
Reviews.Author: Izzet Z
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel near Ataturk Istanbul Airport. Not much things to do nearby, so I would only stay here 1 night to catch a flight the following day. Breakfast was OK. It is self service, but I would have expected the waiters to ask you for tea/coffee. If a 5 star wouldn't do that, who would!

Reviews.Title: “CertaÄ±nly not 5 - star”
Reviews.Author: shenay
Reviews.Content: We arrÄ±ved at 2am havÄ±ng pre-booked a 3-bed room. We were shown to a 2-bed room and Ä±t took over an hour to have the thÄ±rd bed brought to the room. DurÄ±ng thÄ±s tÄ±me we made 3 calls to ReceptÄ±on. We were extremely tÄ±red havÄ±ng flown all nÄ±ght. Breakfast was medÄ±ocre, the tea was stale. The room was clean, the Ä±ndoor pool clean but badly desÄ±gned. 4- star and 5-star accommodatÄ±on and sÄ±de by sÄ±de Ä±n separate buÄ±ldÄ±ngs, so make sure you know Ä±nto whÄ±ch one you are booked . OK for one nÄ±ght stay because of proxÄ±mÄ±ty to aÄ±rport but not worth the prÄ±ce

Reviews.Title: “Stayed overnight because of airport”
Reviews.Author: 150Londonjp
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful polite but hotel is NOT 5star more like 3 star

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel quite close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Paty35
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my little daughter for 2 days in this hotel, because I was in transit and I wanted to see Istanbul as well. The reason that I chose this hotel was the building, that is quite new, and to be honest I am afraid of earthquarke... and all buildings in the historic area are really old. The hotel is not so close to the airport, as it's not walking distance. There are busy roads, and you can't walk to the hotel. Probably you will have some "problem" with the taxcis because they will complain a lot that the hotel is too close, and it's not convenient for them. Anyway you should know that the taxis HAVE TO bring you to the hotel, as they have an agreement with the airport. Well, the room was clean and nice, good size, and decent bathroom. They have a minibar VERY EXPENSIVE, and it's ashamed that they ask more that 2 euro for a very small bottle of water (250ml). The breakfast is average, but it could be improved very much. The coffe is awful, the fruits options are poor and they serve a terrible artificial juice. The breads are ok, the marmelade I didn't try but looked nice, and they have about 5 types os cereals, and milk. There were some pastries as well. The restaurant is ok, but not special. You can find some turkish food, but the price are quite high. The staff is friendly and helpfull, but not everyone speaks english. I sent a guest request form 1 week before my arriving, but it seems that they don't read it, because I didn't find the 5 pillows that I requested (I was with my toddler). I only found 2 terrible pillows on the bed. For the price, the services should be better.

Reviews.Title: “When you need closeness to the airport, go for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luis_de_Zaragoza
Reviews.Content: Big rooms (some cleaning needed in bathroom), shuttle bus to the Airport available every half an hour, lovely crew.

Reviews.Title: “The Wow is Anything But”
Reviews.Author: Craig B
Reviews.Content: I know I'm dreaming if I expect anything more than convenience from an airport hotel, but this place underachieved my lowest expectations. The room was just OK but there was no wireless and the wired LAN only worked for about 5 minutes the entire night we were there. They have no notifications about the water but the fact that they supplied none in bottles unless you paid $4/25cl from the minibar implied that the hotel water was filtered. A call to the desk disabused us of this notion. What hotel pumps in nonpotable water then doesn't give you at least a bottle a day to brush your teeth? There are no restaurants within striking distance of the place, so they have you as a captive audience. $20 burger anyone? And the included breakfast featured Tang and instant coffee along with an array of olives and jams, a few cheeses and a few overly processed inedible meats. Nothing cooked fresh and bad bread with no toaster. To give you an indication, my airplane food breakfast was a feast in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent night!!!”
Reviews.Author: LouHarrison
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wow Airport on our way home, one night in Istanbul. It was our wedding anniversary and I had alerted the hotel. Wow is right! They had a wonderful spread waiting for us, baklava, wine, fruit and an adorable cake! Awesome job!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice For The Airport”
Reviews.Author: flymeaway2
Reviews.Content: After 14 hours of flying and being awake a little over 28 hours with 30 minutes sleep on the flight, we arrived at the Wow Airport Hotel and were very happy we made this choice. We arrived very tired and were hoping for a good night's sleep. After looking at several other airport hotels, the Wow Hotel seemed to stand out and the location was ideal given that we had just picked up a car rental at the airport. It was easy to get to and parking wasn't a problem. The bed was very comfortable along with the bedding and room temperature. Great A/C that was individually controlled. We requested a quiet room and it was a room in a standard hotel hall but wow, the hotel was very quiet. I was surprised to discover we had other guests on the same floor the next morning and I was even more surprised when we went for breakfast and saw all the people. It felt like we were the only guests. Our room was like a cocoon, it was quiet and just what we needed as we slept 12 hours. The breakfast buffet is substantial, items were replenished quickly, tables cleaned and everything was very appetizing. Neither of us enjoyed the full benefit of the buffet just because it was our first morning in Turkey and we didn't have much of an appetite just yet. Service at the hotel is excellent. The front desk staff, bellman, security are all well trained and there to assist you in any way possible. From what we could see, te hotel is well managed. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. This was our first trip to Turkey and the Wow Airport Hotel started our trip off on the right foot.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: WorplesdonSurreyUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with very late arrival at airport 2330hrs. WOW was short 6 TL taxi fare from airport by the Convention Centre. One could walk but traffic too dangerous with bags. Hotel is also close to the DTM Fuar Merkezi metro station (one stop from airport - Havalimani. There are two WOW hotels next to each other; 4 Star & 5 Star. Clean comfortable rooms with ensuite bath and shower, fridge, TV and good sized standard room with large firm bed. Good breakfast buffet with large choice. Free shuttle bus to and from airport during most of day but stops about 2245hrs.

Reviews.Title: “not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: jane d
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the four star hotel which was close to the airport and useful for an overnight stop before flying to uk. The check in was efficient. No help was offered with luggage. The carpets in the corridor were dirty, stained and very unpleasant. The room looked ok when we first went in.The linen was clean and the bathroom was clean a bit tired.There is no kettle so you need to rely on room service that is not cheap. The waiter were very happy to give us a small amount of milk. We didn't feel comfortable walking on the carpet with bare feet. The bed is huge (6 feet) with some very strangly placed mirrors. The mattress was very firm and lumpy on one side (the same side as the mirror in the head board and the very large mirror on the opposite wall!). When you add a glass topped room service display of condoms, g string and what we think were black stockings we did wonder if we were being charged by the hour. Evening meal. The menu was comprehensive but expensive; what one would expect at a airport hotel, Do not order the home made ravioli it was the second worst food I have ever tried to eat I am a regular travler so used to different food it did not give me food poisoning so was not bad. It just tasted oily and stodgy so I did not eat it, the waiter who cleared did not ask why, he proberly new. My parnter ordered a pizza the extra olivess he ordered did not arrive but the waiter realized this and offered to change the pizza we agreed some olives would be fine they quickly arrived. Breakfast was standard not very good for a 4 star Hotel felt qiite sorry for the waiters as the food and the hotel were not four star. Had I been in England and paying for the Hotel I would have left within 5 minuts of arrival. DO not stay here espually if you have children.

Reviews.Title: “ok but certainly not a wow experience”
Reviews.Author: Dan011
Reviews.Content: It took the taxi driver a very long time to find the hotel - even though it is relatively close to the airport. The rooms are nice, bright and large sized for an airport hotel. Internet connection is available free in the room with a dial up cable. However, the staff were not friendly and are ill informed about the local area.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for stopover near airport”
Reviews.Author: doppios
Reviews.Content: Most important feature of this hotel: about 5 minutes from the airport on the free shuttle bus, which goes promptly every half hour. That's what you want when you are involved in some sort of stopover/transfer. Apart from this aspect: - room (on 17th floor) a good size with all facilities you'd expect - greeting at reception was good; check-out more abrupt - room clean apart from carpet, decor a bit dated - quiet - bed a wide king size but definitely on the firm side (think: plank) - room service good and not overpriced (except for wine - BYO!) - breakfast good range (including halva!) but coffee horrible (Turkish coffee ordered separately was 10 TL) Overall completely unobjectionable for one night and good value at 80 euro for 2 inc breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Truly professional”
Reviews.Author: Erdienumnum
Reviews.Content: July 2011 we stayed at wow airport hotel with my 17 year old son and two other friends. We were treated like true guests from the time we entered the hotel till the day we left. We stayed for four days but i wish we could haved stayed longer. Starting from check in to buffet breakfast and staffs willingness to help was truly amazing. Ä° was not sure what to ecpect when i booked this hotel but it was better than staying at a 5 star hotel. The staff had a can do attitude and nothing was too dificult forthem to help you with. Well done to the management, the service desk staff, the room service staff security, cheff and many others who work behind the scenes to make this place a home away from home. Well done and i cant wait to stay with this hotel again. Many thanks to the whole team for making our stay feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with high standards”
Reviews.Author: Satc0
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights there and I was impressed. The hotel is not so far from the airport and can be approached by public transportation or by the taxi service of the hotel (free of charge). The front office is very helpful and they speak good English. I experienced only one problem: every day, after arriving back to the hotel my card to the room was malfunctioning. They kindly changed it every time and said that it could be because of my cell phone but I think that the real problem was with the lock. Anyway not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelissaS91360
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night due to a long layover before our flight home, and on paper it sounded like (and is listed as) a 5-star hotel. However, our experience was quite different. The front desk staff was surly, the carpeting in the hallway was dirty, filthy really, and the bed was incredibly uncomfortable. I feel as if this hotel has received its 5-star rating because of the amenities listed (spa, turkish bath, conference/business center) but that rating is NOT reflected in the quality of the room. Lumpy, small pillows; dirty carpet; huge thumping noises (plumbing perhaps?), completely inadequate a/c, and generally beat-up, worn-out appearance. I hate to say this, but we should have stayed at the Holiday Inn. Plusses include: good shower, good breakfast, free airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep at the airport”
Reviews.Author: aptajulia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the last night of three weeks in Turkey, as we had a plane to catch the next day. It was a very bad way to end what had been an excellent vacation in a lovely country. The hotel/conference centre itself is an architectural wasteland, with two relatively new, but ugly and crumbling hotels linked by a convention center which stretches between them like the Gobi Desert. No amenities or shops or plants enliven the scene. The hotel is dirty from the lobby on through to the corridors to the rooms, with the carpets in a particularly bad state. The bed was brutally uncomfortable. The food is awful (and quite expensive), while the drinks include such innovations as gin-less martinis at about 10$ a pop - rather a lot for ice (in a martini!), a splash of vermouth and a lemon rind. We couldn't decide whether this state of affairs was the result of malevolence or incompetence until we ordered a bottle of water at the bar - the only place to buy water unless you want to minibar it for an arm and a leg. It cost 9 TL, or nine times what one would pay even in the tourist traps around Sultanahmet. The management, in other words, know that they have you hostage and they are determined to extract as much ransom possible for the least trouble and expense. We left as soon as we could in the morning, figuring it would be more comfortable at the airport than in this supposed four star hotel. We were right.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, horrible, dishonest, sleazy staff - never again.”
Reviews.Author: Stang75
Reviews.Content: Wow consists of two hotels - a supposed 5 star and a 4 star. My wife and I stayed in the 5 star for 8 nights for a conference at the nearby expo centre. Problem 1 - my wife was approached for sex by a middle-aged male concierge in her room while I was attending the conference. Problem 2 - check your bill closely when you checkout. My colleagues and I all had problems with them adding room service and hotel bar items to our bill that we did not use. Problem 3 - hotel lobby bar. Check your bill closely again. 1 beer suddenly becomes 3 beers and then you have to argue with them that its their mistake. Problem 4 - the room stank of smoke. Problem 5 - its ridiculously overpriced compared to other hotels in Istanbul. This was the first hotel I stayed in Turkey due to its proximity to my conference venue. After the conference ended I moved to another hotel in Istanbul and was pleasantly surprised to find my new hotel had friendly honest stuff and offered a better quality stay for half of the cost. I would never ever stay at the Wow hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “if you just flew 30 hours to get to istanbul, this is the place to rest.”
Reviews.Author: Phil_MississaugaCA
Reviews.Content: near the airport, and they take care of their property. When I arrived after traveling without sleep for 30 hours, they couldn't find my reservation because I had done it online and chose a wrong date. So I showed up, I was in the wrong, and Adnan took one look at my bleary face and fixed my mistake by resolving it. I was so impressed. An hour later Erman helped me get my Turkish Sim card going by talking with the agent. These guys really bring over the top customer service and delivered it when i was very tired and like a fish out of water. This will be at least my first stop every time i fly into Ataturk airport in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Jetgeo
Reviews.Content: There is a 5 star and a 4 star builing, both are exactly the same....the only difference is the price. All I have to say is that it is a very dirty Hotel, right outside the airport. There are stains on every inch of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel Steps From the Airport”
Reviews.Author: scottanderson1978
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel twice, once as we finished a 2-week backpacking adventure through Turkey prior to flying to Cairo, and then a few weeks later as we were traveling back from Jordan prior to our return flight home. The hotel is immaculate, the service is amazing and the rooms are incredible as well. This is a 5-star hotel experience for a very fair price. The restaurants were a little pricey, however the breakfast buffet was free (at least when we booked our room) and very good. The location is a positive and a negative depending how you look at it. For us, we wanted to be close to the airport and the end of our trips, and the Wow is literally a couple minutes away. The downside of this is that there is not much else around the hotel in terms of shopping, restaurants and the like. For anyone wanting to be in the middle of the action I would not recommend this hotel, as we stayed elsewhere while we were in Istanbul, but as an airport hotel it was the perfect place to stay, as we had early morning flights and did not have to worry about getting up early and spending hours in traffic to get to the airport on time. The hotel is also very accessible via the transit system from downtown and vice versa. We were very impressed with the hotel and would stay there again if we needed a hotel near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Lonely Hotel; Dangerous Outside the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gypsysince72
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far from anything. Airport and even the shopping center which "appears" to be across the street is a $7 cab ride from the hotel (due to a failed bridge, filthy canal, new construction and closed roads, you cannot walk there without going 5 km.) The return cab was $10. Even the cab ride was scary as the cabbie took a dirt path in the middle of a field as a short cut due to closed roads. No human could be seen as we rode in the cab through an empty field with no building or business in sight. We could have been mugged and left for dead in the field. The Wow Hotel claims, to offer pick up service from the airport. That was a lie. After calling them 4 times in 40 minutes and being told they would be there in 10 minutes, each time, we opted for the tram. The tram lets you off at a seedy place with no buildings or people other than a few lonely men standing around watching you walk the dirt road toward the Hotel (about four city blocks away) with no visible security, guest, worker, or hotel staff. It might be better to take one of the dubious airport cab offers who kept trying to talk us into a different hotel their friend owns. The hotel has a fabulous buffet breakfast and wonderful rooms with a large tub. The restaurants were mostly empty and the bar was completely empty all three days/nights. If you book through Expedia, you get a good deal. If you just walk in, the price was 85E for one or 141Euros for 2. If you want to stay at a pricey hotel and not see anyone or anything, but have a great breakfast and few dinner options, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “False representation”
Reviews.Author: lgismail
Reviews.Content: First of all, at the reception we have got two separate rooms no matter that we were explaining again and again that we are married couple. She didnâ€™t want even to discuss about it. Pretty weird, donâ€™t you thing. The window of the room (1019) was half opened without possibility to fix it, so it wasnâ€™t quiet in it. The coffee that we have got by room service was awful it was cold and you could imagine that it is coffee only by the color and smell. The prices of room service offers are as high as in five star hotels and the thing that you got are as if you are on diet. The offer at breakfast was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice very close to airport”
Reviews.Author: SoloChickinLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice--once when flying in, again when flying out. Both times my room was huge, clean, modern--up to a Western standard for hotel rooms. Easily the biggest hotel room I've ever stayed in abroad. Big shower/bathtub! Very huge hotel, on the same property as the WOW Istanbul hotel--they're right next door to each other. English language stations on tv, but no in-room WiFi (had to go to lobby for it). Huge breakfast buffet. You can't drink the tap water in Istanbul & this hotel jacks you for water & sodas from the minibar. On the upside, the Margarita pizza from room service was tasty. Very friendly front desk staff. MAJOR drag was the lack of air conditioning in both of my rooms. They say they have it, but when you turn it on, it's just a low-speed fan--no cold air gets produced. I was uncomfortably warm on both occasions. Easily enough coped with for a night, but would be problematic for longer stays. Airport shuttle service was right on time--BUT! If you want to take the free shuttle to the city center area of Istanbul for a day of sightseeing, you have to reserve a spot well in advance. No one mentioned this to me upon check-in & it's not mentioned in any of the in-room materials. And there are only two shuttles per day--one in the morning, one in the very late afternoon. Very, very close to the tram stop, so you can easily travel around. You go to the tram stop, buy a token, take the tram to Zeytinburnu (sp?), get out & transfer to the tram heading toward Sultanahamet. Whole thing takes maybe half an hour. Taxi from airport to hotel took less than 5 minutes & cost 5 TL. Would probably stay here again if price were less than the one I paid this time or if being so close to the airport were very important.

Reviews.Title: “wowed in the wrong way”
Reviews.Author: GGZOLA
Reviews.Content: Walked into nasty room; dirty carpets, blood-stained headboard, and other lovely amentiies. Horrific mattress, holes in sheet (must be swiss sheets) rusted, not rustic bath tub, felt like i was in a scene from the turkish prison in midnight express. Slow elevators, the only good here is the breakfast. Was begging for mercy after a couple hours. They should change the hotel name to Stains R us. Tv doesnt work, stains everywhere, filthy, disgusting to the max. Please, ignore all positive reviews they must be stoned like the guy in midnight express.

Reviews.Title: “Too many faults”
Reviews.Author: BritTravellingAround
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wow hotel for one night to ensure a leisurely morning before our flight. There are two indentical-looking Wow hotels next to each other - one is apparently five star with an indoor pool and the other is four star without the pool. We were in the four star. The hotel is located close to the Metro station one stop before the airport stop (I forget the name). Nice and convenient in terms of location. The free shuttle bus the following morning was useful the following morning. We got our room and it smelt of cigarette smoke (to be fair they might have moved us, but we couldn't be bothered to complain). There is no wifi in the room so you're restricted to cable access to the internet. The room was fine - clean and spacious with a flat-screen TV and the bathroom had a decent bath and shower. Eating options weren't great. The hotel restaurant looked expensive and limited and there was nothing within walking distance. So we went to the airport and had some fast-food! What really annoyed us was that the reception staff refused to post our postcards! I've never known that before. Typical of a hotel with little regard for customer service. We paid Â£62 - not particularly cheap for a bog-standard airport hotel - so we were not impressed. On balance I would only stay here if I had a very early flight the next morning. Otherwise it's easy enough to get to the airport by Metro from the tourist areas of Sultanahmet or Taksim (though it gets crowded during work days).

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: TwoLove2Travel
Reviews.Content: We had a layover in Istanbul and had enough time to explore the old city while there. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable and the breakfast was great. They offer free shuttle to and from the airport. Also, the metro (a very inexpensive way to get to city center) is within walking distance from the hotel. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Goldy15
Reviews.Content: Very close to the airport and having the shuttle, also to Taksim, so really very convenient. Made for overnight between flights, but also rather comfortable. Nice and friendly staff. Functional and modern rooms. Haven't been able to open the window (but little and with staff help - special device needed, apparently for security reasons), asked for double bed and got twin bed, the view is not great, but all in all a good hotel Suggest wireless internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, definitely not "WOW"!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewW2
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets top points for being close to the airport since that is what I wanted. 5 minutes by cab and 5 Lira. Forget looking for the shuttle which runs every 30 minutes and stops at 2245. There are two WOW hotels which are right next to each other. Apparently I was staying in the 5 star one (according to the taxi driver) and there is a 2 star next door. Check in was quick, staff efficient. Lobby nothing special but all it needs to be. Got room on 4th floor. Room felt somewhat dated but clean. Had a hard time with TV, either batteries in remote were really weak or just really poor interface. Not much in the way of international programming. Had a hard time getting temperature down in the room and was difficult to sleep, despite it being in the cold of January. Large selection at breakfast but strangely none of it very appealing. I eat just about anything but ended up only have a cup of coffee and some canned peaches. Breakfast room felt depressing as there are these stark florescent lights in mostly darkness - maybe better in the Summer. Lots of Japanese tourists and Turkish workers in boiler suits, strange mix. Check-out fine, didn't use spa or pool but would have liked to try. So overall, nothing special and definitely not "wow!" but for the price and location and it being only one night, no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Dispicable Management!”
Reviews.Author: Mooonie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent our last night in Turkey at the WOW Airport Hotel after having spent the most wonderful 3-week vacation in magical places and excellent hotels. However, this one last night was an absolute and utter nightmare! Upon stepping into our room we were overwhelmed by the strong odor or air freshner...it was clear that they were trying to cover up some other smell but it was just awful. The carpet in the room was badly stained and oh so very dirty! Please know that not once have I ever given a hotel a bad review (please see my othe rpostings), but this was just plain ridiculous. But that is just scratching the surface of this poor excuse of a hotel's actual issue: The management at this hotel and among the least helpful and rude you will ever come across. We had a carpet shipped to the hotel from Cappadocia. I made sure to call the hotel when I purchased the carpet to let them know I was expecting such a package. However, upon check-in the was no record of this on my file. Needless to say we had to leave Turkey the next day without our carpet, quite aware that this will incure extra shipping charges and duties. Upon our return home the carpet shop contacted us as the hotel had retuned them the package!!! But the hotel mentionned noting of this to us and told us we were responsible of the 200$ shipping fees we were now faced with because of their mistake. They wre rude and unhelpful throughout this entire ordeal. Just to prove how cowardly they really are: they eventua;;ly promised to cover a part of the shipping costs, but when I sent them the invoice I suddenly never heard back from them. Needless to say I woul drather give this hotel a bad name and reputationinstead of wasting any more time trying to run after poor management.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Chalkie560
Reviews.Content: Five minutes from the airport, so very convienient if arriving late or starting early. Breakfast great choice available. Room good size and with good facilities, very clean and comfortable throught the hotel. Good polite staff. One point to note it is tailored for business travellers so it appears the prices for food & drink are set for folks that can claim on expences. Other than that a very nice comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD COMPORTABLE STAY”
Reviews.Author: prakash179
Reviews.Content: I visit Istanbul frequently on buisness, whenever I visit patronise Wow Istanbul. Travel to the hotel is very conenient- good proximity to airport. Good loacation- close to Nile and City Centre Downtown.Overall lifts are required. Consists of clean spacious rooms but small lobby. The restaurant is under renovation hence few options for international cuisine. Well staffed. Language is an issue also telephone charges are high. It was a good comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: spry13
Reviews.Content: Met our needs for an early morning flight. Easily took shuttle from hotel to airport. Clean. Breakfast fine. Make sure you go into the correct WOW; there are 2 side by side. Has a free shuttle downtown, but we did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight stay at Airport”
Reviews.Author: emergencyvacation
Reviews.Content: Ideal for a one night stay when catching an early flight at Ataturk Airport. Beware that there are two adjacent Wow Hotels at the airport. If your taxi gets it wrong it is not a big dael as you can walk between the two hotels. To avoid the walk, tell the taxi if your taxi if you are booked at the 4 Star Wow or the 5 Star Wow. Good buffet breakfast and comfortable beds.
